name: PolyAI
description: PolyAI is a London-based technology company with a state-of-the-art machine learning platform for creating conversational agents. The PolyAI platform empowers contact centres, allowing them to deliver the next-generation of customer experience at a fraction of the cost paid by their competitors. PolyAI’s conversational AI agents understand users and can hold conversations without getting confused. They are available 24/7 and can easily scale to support new use cases or to speak almost any world language.

team.title: Chief Scientist
team.name: Pei-Hao Su
team.bioHtml: Co-founder & Chief Scientist @PolyAI • Worked @Facebook • PhD @Cambridge (ML/NLP/Dialogue)

team.title: CEO
team.name: Nikola Mrkšić
team.bioHtml: CEO & Co-Founder @PolyAI • Worked at @Apple, @VocalIQ. PhD from @University of Cambridge.

team.title: CTO

team.bioHtml: Co-founder and CTO @PolyAI • Worked at @Google, @Entrepreneur First, Research Consultant @IPsoft

team.title: Content Manager

team.bioHtml: Product marketer with a passion for startups

team.name: Paul Annetts
team.bioHtml:
- Engineering Team Lead at Poly AI.
- ex-CTO at Hutoma
- Software Engineer at Microsoft UK, as FTE and contractor.
- PhD Engineering University of Bristol.

jobs.title: VP Product
jobs.description:
Reporting to Chief Executive Officer & Co-Founder, you will drive the growth of PolyAI by rapidly establishing and developing their Product Management function. You will bring dedicated Product Management expertise into the organization and, in close collaboration with Nikola and Shawn Wen, Chief Technology Officer & Co-Founder, own the overall product strategy for the business. You will work to deliver both large step-change product advancement efforts and continued high-velocity incremental innovation. You will establish best practices and implement world-class product management processes in order to meet the demands and quality standards expected by enterprise customers. 

Key Responsibilities 
•	Lead and define product mission, strategy and management practices at a leadership and business level in a period of critical business growth. 
•	Define the overall product vision with founders and own the resulting product roadmap in partnership with the executive team. 
•	Communicate a clear product vision and roadmap to the entire team, and to PolyAI’s clients. 
•	Own the end-to-end processes related to product discovery, from identifying problems and opportunities, to defining solutions that will deliver to our customers. 
•	Make the tough decisions about what PolyAI will and will not do, balancing long-term product vision with short term commercial pressures. Justify this with clear analysis. 
•	Define and implement working practices for Product Management as a function and approach to engagement with other functions. 
•	As the team starts scaling, hire and mentor great product managers and product designers to build a world class team. 
•	Drive product development forward by ensuring crystal-clear understanding of the various product requirements, expectations and timelines for all stakeholders. 
•	Continuously drive process development: improvement in ideation, conceptualization, implementation and qualification of new features. 
•	Coordinate the collection of high-quality, nuanced client feedback. Ensure that the entire company understands client needs and how the products can address them 
•	Engage directly, where appropriate, with clients and support commercial efforts.
•	 Keep abreast of product trends and explore opportunities for product innovation to ensure a best in class product experience. 
•	Look beyond where the market is today, and ensure that the company maintains a competitive advantage. 
•	As a member of the management team, contribute to the overall business strategy. Aid in the identification of new opportunities. 

Key Requirements 
•	 Extensive experience as a product leader/manager within a hyper-growth early stage business that successfully scaled, e.g. from Series A to Series C and beyond. 
•	Strong understanding of Enterprise software products and businesses. Ideally, you will also have solid grounding and expertise in complex platform / API-based products. 
•	Excellent communicator, low ego, capable of motivating and energising the broader team and peers, with a proven ability to create a highly collaborative working environment. 
•	Deep analytical skills and demonstrable track record of a data-driven approach to product management. 
•	Technically literate and able to engage and collaborate closely with engineering counterparts. Ideally you have a technical degree (Computer Science or similar) from a leading university and/or experience as a software engineer within a world-leading technology organisation. 
•	Ideally, you have experience managing, recruiting, coaching and developing highly skilled talent in product management, design and user experience at all levels of an organisation. 
•	Demonstrable success in interpreting technology and market trends, converting these into winning product strategies, and successfully executing on these strategies and have them drive commercial success. 
•	Positive outlook, a hands-on approach and a naturally high work ethic focused on swift execution will be essential for this role as the company scales.

**Closing Date for Application: 28th May 2020**
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Reporting to Chief Executive Officer & Co-Founder, you will drive the growth of PolyAI by rapidly establishing and developing their Product Management function. You will bring dedicated Product Management expertise into the organization and, in close collaboration with Nikola and Shawn Wen, Chief Technology Officer & Co-Founder, own the overall product strategy for the business. You will work to deliver both large step-change product advancement efforts and continued high-velocity incremental innovation. You will establish best practices and implement world-class product management processes in order to meet the demands and quality standards expected by enterprise customers.

Key Responsibilities
• Lead and define product mission, strategy and management practices at a leadership and business level in a period of critical business growth.
• Define the overall product vision with founders and own the resulting product roadmap in partnership with the executive team.
• Communicate a clear product vision and roadmap to the entire team, and to PolyAI’s clients.
• Own the end-to-end processes related to product discovery, from identifying problems and opportunities, to defining solutions that will deliver to our customers.
• Make the tough decisions about what PolyAI will and will not do, balancing long-term product vision with short term commercial pressures. Justify this with clear analysis.
• Define and implement working practices for Product Management as a function and approach to engagement with other functions.
• As the team starts scaling, hire and mentor great product managers and product designers to build a world class team.
• Drive product development forward by ensuring crystal-clear understanding of the various product requirements, expectations and timelines for all stakeholders.
• Continuously drive process development: improvement in ideation, conceptualization, implementation and qualification of new features.
• Coordinate the collection of high-quality, nuanced client feedback. Ensure that the entire company understands client needs and how the products can address them
• Engage directly, where appropriate, with clients and support commercial efforts.
• Keep abreast of product trends and explore opportunities for product innovation to ensure a best in class product experience.
• Look beyond where the market is today, and ensure that the company maintains a competitive advantage.
• As a member of the management team, contribute to the overall business strategy. Aid in the identification of new opportunities.

Key Requirements
• Extensive experience as a product leader/manager within a hyper-growth early stage business that successfully scaled, e.g. from Series A to Series C and beyond.
• Strong understanding of Enterprise software products and businesses. Ideally, you will also have solid grounding and expertise in complex platform / API-based products.
• Excellent communicator, low ego, capable of motivating and energising the broader team and peers, with a proven ability to create a highly collaborative working environment.
• Deep analytical skills and demonstrable track record of a data-driven approach to product management.
• Technically literate and able to engage and collaborate closely with engineering counterparts. Ideally you have a technical degree (Computer Science or similar) from a leading university and/or experience as a software engineer within a world-leading technology organisation.
• Ideally, you have experience managing, recruiting, coaching and developing highly skilled talent in product management, design and user experience at all levels of an organisation.
• Demonstrable success in interpreting technology and market trends, converting these into winning product strategies, and successfully executing on these strategies and have them drive commercial success.
• Positive outlook, a hands-on approach and a naturally high work ethic focused on swift execution will be essential for this role as the company scales.

Closing Date for Application: 28th May 2020

jobs.title: Software Engineer Contractor, Telephony
jobs.description:
We’re looking for a Software Engineer with strong experiences in telephony infrastructure (Asterisk), on a fixed term contract of 3 months duration.

We’re looking for someone passionate and creative to join our dynamic team in creating innovative conversational AI products for customer service. Collaborating with other engineers, your responsibilities will involve building an in-house telephony pipeline for our conversational AI products.

***Over the next 3 months you will be:***

Joining our infrastructure team, and have a direct impact on our telephony infrastructure.
Developing an in-house Asterisk telephony server to support our conversational AI products from the ground up.
Integrating the Asterisk server with 3rd party ASR providers and our AWS services.
Deploying the Asterisk server to our cloud and improve latency and system robustness.
Mentoring and working closely with other engineers.
Minimal Requirements:

2+ years of Experience in Asterisk Telephony Server, including installation and maintenance of an Asterisk deployment.
Experience in working with SIP RFCs & audio codecs.
Ability to troubleshoot, analyze, and resolve VOIP related problems. Identify root causes and recommend workarounds.
Working knowledge of WAN & LAN networks specially SD WAN, MPLS, VPN.
Working proficiency in verbal and written English
Preferred Requirements:

Understand fundamentals of Linux system administration.
Understanding of security with regards to SIP.
Understanding of enterprise VOIP architecture including intermediary devices relating to SIP & VOIP networks.
Familiarity with VOIP CTI integration methods
Experience with monitoring SIP services.
Experience with one or more cloud services: AWS, GCP, Azure
Experience with one or more programming languages such as Python, Golang, JavaScript, Java or C/C++
PolyAI aspires to lead the digital transformation of customer services through conversational AI technologies. We believe the best team will consist of people with diverse perspectives, ideas, and cultures, reflecting the multicultural and multilingual background of our customers.

Come do the best work of your life here at PolyAI!

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Telephony
jobs.description:
We’re looking for someone passionate and creative to join our team in creating innovative conversational AI products for customer service. Collaborating with other engineers, your responsibilities will involve building an in-house telephony pipeline for our conversational AI products.

Over the next 12 months you will be:

Joining our infrastructure team, and have a direct impact on our telephony infrastructure.
Developing an in-house Asterisk telephony server to support our conversational AI products from the ground up.
Integrating the Asterisk server with 3rd party ASR providers and our AWS services.
Deploying the Asterisk server to our cloud and improve latency and system robustness.
Maintaining deployments and working on new telephony features.
Leading the telephony integration project with our enterprise clients.
Minimal Requirements:

2+ years of Experience in Asterisk Telephony Server, including installation and maintenance of an Asterisk deployment.
Experience in working with SIP RFCs & audio codecs.
Ability to troubleshoot, analyze, and resolve VOIP related problems. Identify root causes and recommend workarounds.
Working knowledge of WAN & LAN networks specially SD WAN, MPLS, VPN.
Working proficiency in verbal and written English
Preferred Requirements:

Understand fundamentals of Linux system administration.
Understanding of security with regards to SIP.
Understanding of enterprise VOIP architecture including intermediary devices relating to SIP & VOIP networks.
Familiarity with VOIP CTI integration methods
Experience with monitoring SIP services.
Experience with one or more cloud services: AWS, GCP, Azure
Experience with one or more programming languages such as Python, Golang, JavaScript, Java or C/C++
PolyAI aspires to lead the digital transformation of customer services through conversational AI technologies. We believe the best team will consist of people with diverse perspectives, ideas, and cultures, reflecting the multicultural and multilingual background of our customers.

Come do the best work of your life here at PolyAI!

Benefits:

25 days holiday pay, 10 days working from home allowance, pension scheme, health & dental insurance

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Dialogue
jobs.description:
We are looking for someone passionate and creative to join our dialogue team in creating innovative conversational AI products for customer service. Collaborating with the product and engineering teams, your responsibility will involve prototyping conversational AI behaviours in multiple domains and measuring and adjusting agent behaviours according to user feedback.

***Over the next 12 months you will be:***

Joining our dialogue team, and have a direct impact on our customer-facing conversational AI products.
Developing and maintaining system behaviour using our internal platform, and working closely with product and engineering teams to update products on a weekly basis
Increasing coverage, accuracy, and user experiences of our products
Working on automatic tests and A/B experiments to make data-driven product development possible.
Helping to bring insights and improvements to our conversational AI platform
Minimum Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree or Master’s Degree in Computer Science
Experience with one or more programming languages such as Python, Golang, JavaScript, Java or C/C++
Strong scripting and debugging skills
Working proficiency in verbal and written English
Preferred Requirements:

Experience with language data processing
Experience with dialogue design
Experience with one or more cloud services: AWS, GCP, Azure
Experience with professional software engineering best practices, such as coding standards, code reviews, source control, build processes, and testing
Having a user-centric mindset and caring about conversational / NLP experiences
PolyAI aspires to lead the digital transformation of customer services through our conversational AI technologies. We believe the best team will consist of people with diverse perspectives, ideas, and cultures, reflecting the multicultural and multilingual background of our customers.

Come do the best work of your life here at PolyAI!

Benefits:

25 days holiday pay, 10 days working from home allowance, pension scheme, health & dental insurance

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.description:
We are looking for someone passionate and creative to join our dialogue team in creating innovative conversational AI products for customer service. Collaborating with the product and engineering teams, your responsibilities will involve integrating our products with client’s systems and advancing our products and technology for customer services.


***Over the next 12 months you will be:***

Joining our platform team, and have a direct impact on our customer-facing conversational AI products.
Integrating our conversational AI with client’s telephony and CRM systems.
Prototyping conversational systems in different domains.
Helping to bring insights and improvements to our conversational AI platform
Participating in solving difficult AI problems such as speech recognition and language understanding.

Minimum Requirements:

BS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field involving coding, or equivalent industry experience.
Experience with algorithms, data structures, complexity analysis, and software design.
Experience with one or more programming languages such as Python, Golang, JavaScript, Java or C/C++.
Working proficiency in verbal and written English.

Preferred Requirements:

MS degree, or further education in Computer Science or a related field.
1-2 years of commercial software development experience.
HTML5/CSS experience with a Javascript framework like VueJS or React.
Experience with Docker/Kubernetes.
Experience with one or more cloud services: AWS, GCP, Azure.
Experience with professional software engineering best practices, such as coding standards, code reviews, source control, build processes, and testing.

PolyAI aspires to lead the digital transformation of customer services through our conversational AI technologies. We believe the best team will consist of people with diverse perspectives, ideas, and cultures, reflecting the multicultural and multilingual background of our customers.

Come do the best work of your life here at PolyAI!

Benefits:

25 days holiday pay, 10 days working from home allowance, pension scheme, health & dental insurance

jobs.title: Speech Engineer, Speech Recognition
jobs.description:
We’re looking for someone passionate and creative to join our team in creating innovative conversational AI products for customer service. Collaborating with other software and machine learning engineers, your responsibilities will involve improving our speech recognition (ASR)  for contact centres.

***Over the next 12 months, you will be:***

Reviewing our existing 3rd party ASR solutions and making decisions for further improvement.
Comparing and benchmarking multiple 3rd party ASR solutions based on our business requirements.
Investigating building in-house ASR solutions for particular use cases, such as alphanumerical string recognition.
Creating and managing data collection pipelines, as well as the training of acoustic and language models.
Managing and improving our production ASR systems.
Minimal Requirements:

MS degree, PhD, or further education in Computer Science or a related technical field involving coding, or equivalent industry experience
2+ years of hands-on experience in speech technology and off-the-shelf ASR / TTS toolkits (e.g. Kaldi, Google / IBM / Amazon ASR services, Tacotron 2, Wavenet)
Experience with one or more programming languages such as Python, Golang, JavaScript, Java or C/C++
Working proficiency in verbal and written English
Preferred Requirements:

Experience with one or more cloud services: AWS, GCP, Azure
Experience in VoIP telephony systems and real-time audio streaming and processing
Experience in voice communication services such as Twilio is a plus
Experience with algorithms, data structures, complexity analysis, and software design
PolyAI aspires to lead the digital transformation of customer services through conversational AI technologies. We believe the best team will consist of people with diverse perspectives, ideas, and cultures, reflecting the multicultural and multilingual background of our customers.

Come do the best work of your life here at PolyAI!

Benefits
25 days holiday pay, 10 days working from home allowance, pension scheme, health & dental insurance

skills: Amazon Lex, Twilio, AWS Lambda, and Google Speech API

jobs.title: Software Engineering Lead
jobs.description:
We’re looking for someone passionate and creative to join our team in creating innovative conversational AI products for customer service. Working alongside other engineers and machine learning researchers, your main responsibility will be leading a team of software engineers to deliver user-centric product to our clients.

***Over the next 12 months you will:***

Line-managing one or more teams of software engineers.
Taking a hands-on role in software development, through writing specifications, code and performing code reviews.
Holding regular 1:1s with your reports to both give and receive feedback.
Coaching, mentoring, and developing highly performing individuals.
Monitoring and managing the performance of your reports.
Assisting with productivity or communication issues.
Recruiting: identifying requirements, improving recruitment processes, interviewing and onboarding new engineers.
Contributing to management best practices within the company.
Supporting technical leads and product managers to ensure timely product delivery.
Minimum Requirements:

BS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field involving coding (e.g., physics or mathematics), or equivalent industry experience.
Working proficiency in verbal and written English.
Experience with professional software engineering best practices, such as coding standards, code reviews, source control, build processes, and testing.
Capable of leading a team of 3-5 engineers.
Preferred Requirements:

4+ years in Software Engineering and 1+ year of experience in management.
Skilled in coding, experienced in algorithms, data structures, complexity analysis, and software design.
Experience with Docker / Kubernetes.
Experience with one or more cloud services: AWS, GCP, Azure.
Familiar with Applied Machine Learning fundamentals.
PolyAI aspires to lead the digital transformation of customer services through our conversational AI technologies. We believe the best team will consist of people with diverse perspectives, ideas, and cultures, reflecting the multicultural and multilingual background of our customers.

Come do the best work of your life here at PolyAI!

Coaching, mentoring, and developing highly performing individuals.
Monitoring and managing the performance of your reports.
Assisting with productivity or communication issues.
Recruiting: identifying requirements, improving recruitment processes, interviewing and onboarding new engineers.
Contributing to management best practices within the company.
Supporting technical leads and product managers to ensure timely product delivery.
Minimum Requirements:

BS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field involving coding (e.g., physics or mathematics), or equivalent industry experience.
Working proficiency in verbal and written English.
Experience with professional software engineering best practices, such as coding standards, code reviews, source control, build processes, and testing.
Capable of leading a team of 3-5 engineers.
Preferred Requirements:

4+ years in Software Engineering and 1+ year of experience in management.
Skilled in coding, experienced in algorithms, data structures, complexity analysis, and software design.
Experience with Docker / Kubernetes.
Experience with one or more cloud services: AWS, GCP, Azure.
Familiar with Applied Machine Learning fundamentals.
